attributes.action: STOP COUNCIL TAX INSPECTORS FROM HAVING RIGHT OF ENTRY, WHICH INCLUDES FORCED ENTRY. THIS  VIOLATES OUR HUMAN RIGHTS
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The Government wish to have right of access to your home so that they can assess what council tax to charge based on the condition and improvements. If they do not gain access with your permission the next step they can take is to fine you up to £1000 and then £200 for each day you refuse entry, this is an excessive fine which does not reflect the gravity of the alleged offence and should be scrapped or greatly reduced. Additionally and this is of greater concern make a forced entry into your house within as little as 24 hours. Surely this MUST contravene the human rights act

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
